title: Man shot dead in Jersey City; second in less than 24 hours
content:
UPDATE: Teen with passion basketball shot dead in Jersey City, friends say
JERSEY CITY -- A male was fatally shot early Monday morning in the Bergen-Lafayette section of the city, officials said.
The shooting was reported at around 1:30 a.m. on Van Horne Street between Halladay and Carbon streets, a spokesman for Hudson County Prosecutor's Office has confirmed.
The victim, whose identity has not yet been released, was pronounced dead at the scene. Additional information was not immediately available.
The early morning shooting was reported at about 2 a.m. in the small neighborhood outside of Journal Square. One person was pronounced dead at the scene, officials said.
Monday's fatal shooting is the second in less than 24 hours in Jersey City. Early Sunday morning 35-year-old Shaheer Parson was shot multiple times on Van Wagenen Avenue, where he was pronounced dead.
If ruled a homicide, Monday's fatal shooting will be the 16th homicide in Jersey City this year.
